data.title: Instead... I will try breakfast the next time
data.text: Upon arriving at the South Cape Diner we were impressed with its calm, clean environment and the friendly waitress. The Diner, which routinely served breakfast and lunch, just recently began serving dinner. I ordered fish and chips off the dinner menu. My meal was served hot with a nice bunch of grilled asparagus. It all looked promising until I realized that only one small piece of fish on my plate appeared to look like the Cod I ordered and the the other two looked like fish sticks from the grocery store freezer. As I dug in, my concerns were validated. I was very disappointed. The fish stick triangle shaped pieces were flavorless and over cooked; however the small Cod piece was decent and was clearly not the same type of fish as the other pieces. This was my first visit to the diner, so to be fair I will try it again - but not for dinner. I think they may need a little more time to perfect their dinner menu offerings. The next time I will try breakfast.

data.title: Solid, Basic Breakfast
data.text:
I was in Cape Coral for two, brief days and wanted breakfast before heading to the airport. I had seen a sign the previous day while at the UPS store..."Special: two eggs, toast, meat, coffee...$5.99" sounded good so I gave it a try.
     I entered through the back and was greeted before I could pull the door open. There was one couple eating outside and two other couples inside. I picked my booth and sat as another couple sat in the same section. The waitress, Susie, arrived immediately and took drink orders from both tables, with the outside waitress hovering to provide help if needed. The rest of the meal included the same attentive service. 
     Now the food. Solid, basic breakfast no frills and plenty of food. Coffee was standard diner fare with plenty of refills. I ordered the Country Scrambler with home fries and a biscuit of gravy. More food than I anticipated but I finished it. Home fries were a touch under seasoned (it may be due to the population requesting 'low salt') but cooked well. The biscuit was ok and I enjoyed the white gravy with it's bite of black pepper. 
     On the down side...too much cheese, orange juice did not give me the "Florida Feel" and the sounds from devices were an odd mix. I was able to see and hear an old black & white rerun of Perry Mason on the television with Aerosmith rocking in the background. 
     If you're looking for a solid breakfast, excellent service, quick turnaround at a very affordable price...South Cape Diner will satisfy.

data.title: Not My Favorite Place
data.text: This place is nothing special at all.  With so much to choose from in Cape Coral, why bother going to a mediocre restaurant?  The food is not great here and the atmosphere leaves a lot to be desired.  Don't bother.

data.title: Grilled Shrimp Salad
data.text: Went here for lunch and had the grilled shrimp salad. Lots of succulent shrimp that were cooked to perfection! Highly recommend this place, can't wait to go back and try breakfast and dinner. Rachel, our server was excellent as well.

data.title: Great Breakfasts!
data.text: Cute little diner with large selection of breakfasts. Food is always really good and service is always fast and friendly. Can't ask for much more than that!

data.title: Good breakfast
data.text: My husband and I visited for breakfast.  I had poached eggs and he had a huge breakfast platter.  The home fries were wonderful and the portions were huge!  We would definitely return.

data.title: Large, very good breakfast
data.text: We love this place. Have been here 3 times for breakfast. Large portions, friendly, fast service. Really affordable, would highly recommend. We are going to try lunch and dinner sometime too. Had Mexican omelet and almost forgot to take a pic 😁. Could only eat half!

data.title: Great spot for breakfast
data.text: This is such a cute little diner. Great for breakfast and lunch. We were here on Thirsday around 10 am and the place was almost empty. My husband ordered the breakfast sandwich with eggs, sausage and cheese on wheat toast. It was huge. Looked like 2-3 eggs. I had an English muffin and a thick slice of grilled ham which was delicious. We had soft drinks and the tab was $12 without tip

data.title: Fast friendly service
data.text: Fast, friendly service.  Large portions, very reasonably priced.  Nice bright interior, with an outdoor eating area available.

data.title: just ok
data.text: They lost me when they served me frozen spinach in my omelet, everything else was just average . Nothing special , alittle on the dirty  side

data.title: Nothing Special
data.text: We ate here once.  It's ok.  Menu is limited.  Food is ok,.  We live in the area and there is nothing to draw us back to eat here again.

data.title: Stay away
data.text: Waitress was nice. Downhill from there. Reuben sandwich was packed with chewy corned beef. Bread was SOGGY !!! Wife had breaded oysters . HORRIBLE !! She was sick the rest of the day!!! Wouldn't recommend it to an enemy.

data.title: Lots for your $
data.text: The South Cape Diner is a good local spot. I have gone here multiple times and have always had a decent meal.  I typically order an egg platter that comes with meat and toast.  The menu says two eggs. I would like to know how they make two eggs so filling...it definitely seems more like 3-4.  The coffee is what you would expect from a diner. They do offer beer and mimosas.  Mimosas cost around $4. I recently had the crepes here and would probably not order them again.  There was too much cream cheese in them for me. I am sure I will be back here and would recommend this place to anyone looking for a simple, quick meal as many places in the Cape do not open until later in the morning.

data.title: Great
data.text:
A wonderful place to eat. Plenty of food, great service and low prices 
Try it your love it 
Even though it's breakfast and lunch you will not be disappointed. 
Great specials

data.title: Decent
data.text: Use to go here back when I lived in the Cape. It's an okay place to grab a quick bite to eat. Good eggs, bacon and grits, however the biscuits and gravy, were so-so. The biscuits seemed like they were frozen. But it's been a while since my last visit.

data.title: Meh
data.text: Ordered chicken tenders and fries. Both over cooked. Fries had no flavor at all. Chicken was somewhat pallatible. Have to try one of the sandwiches next time. They looked good coming out of the kitchen.

data.title: Great Little Diner
data.text: Visited 5/23 after reading all reviews, glad I did . Large portions for the money, cooked perfectly. Next time in The Cape definitely go to spot for breakfast. Didn't have time for dinner but would try for         sure. There is a rear entrance and some tables out back, plenty of parking out back also .

data.title: Weekend breakfast
data.text: We stopped today for breakfast. I had the ham and a bagel which was lightly toasted and came with a packets of butter. My husband had the breakfast sandwich with eggs, bacon and cheese on wheat toast. There must have been at least 3 eggs and 6 pieces of bacon on the sandwich. It was enormous and overflowing the pieces of toast. He said it was delicious. We had a coffee and soft drink and our tab was $14 without tip. Service was friendly and prompt. The tables turn over quickly so never be discouraged by a wait. It will truly only be minutes usually

data.title: Great Diner
data.text: I have eaten here a few times and the food is always flavorful and well prepared. I like the pecan waffle where if you request it they will incorporate the pecans into the waffle. Always a great place for breakfast or lunch

data.title: Need better service
data.text: Went to South Cape Diner and the food was good but they need to focus on the service. Waitress was not attentive, asked for drinks, brought us not what we asked for. Took for ever to take our order.
